narrative.narrative: KLM Cityhopper is a regional subsidiary of KLM. It was formed when NLM Cityhopper and its parent Netherlines were bought by KLM. In 2003 KLM UK also merged with KLM Cityhopper. They fly to 44 destinations all in Europe and as of October 2014 had 28 Embraer 190ER's and 19 Fokker 70's. Their past fleet includes many other Fokker planes and Saab 340's.
